FuncDef:
The nat alarm no-pat address-group disable command disables the log and trap functions for No-PAT address pools.
The undo nat alarm no-pat address-group disable command restores the default configuration.
By default, the log and trap functions for No-PAT address pools is enabled
CLIs: nat alarm no-pat address-group { log | trap } disable
undo nat alarm no-pat address-group { log | trap } disable

ParaDef.Info:
Enables or disables the log alarm function for No-PAF address pools.
-

Enables or disables the trap function for No-PAT address pools.
-

Enables the trap or log function for No-PAT address pools.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-nat-instance-cpe1] nat alarm no-pat address-group trap disable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The log and alarm functions for No-PAT address pools are enabled by default. To disable the log and trap functions for No-PAT address pools, run the nat alarm No-pat address-group disable.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the NAT address pool in non-easy IP mode.
This command is applicable to the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S and VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
